definition: the back door/fig. under the counter (indirect way for influence or pressure)/anus

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
lit. to enter by the back door/fig. to gain influence by pull or unofficial channels/back door or under the counter connections
to open the back door/fig. under the counter/to do a secret or dishonest deal/to let sth in by the back door
to beat a tiger from the front door, only to have a wolf come in at the back (idiom); fig. facing one problem after another
pinyin: qian2 men2 da3 hu3 , hou4 men2 da3 lang2

definition: to beat a tiger from the front door, only to have a wolf come in at the back (idiom); fig. facing one problem after another
pinyin: qian2 men2 ju4 hu3 , hou4 men2 jin4 lang2

sentences.english: Come in by the back door, then no one will notice you.
sentences.chinese: 從後門進來，那樣沒有人注意你。

sentences.english: At the Vanity Fair party, they were let in the back door.
sentences.chinese: 在《名利場》雜誌的聚會上，他們從後門進來。

sentences.english: “We close the front door, and they go through the back door,” he says.
sentences.chinese: Tith說，“我們把前門關了，他們還會走後門。”

sentences.english: We fear it could also be a backdoor to censorship of the internet.
sentences.chinese: 我們擔心，這可能也是一個後門互聯網的審查。

sentences.english: You should enjoy free lunch, what have to allow a family to open your home is postern .
sentences.chinese: 你要享用免費的午餐，就得允許人家打開你家的後門。

sentences.english: The route of removal of the deceased should be through the back of the House to avoid any public attention.
sentences.chinese: 在運離屍體的過程中應走後門，避免引起公衆的注意。

sentences.english: Scampish software and postern trojan, privately installs a lot of scampish software for the user.
sentences.chinese: 流氓軟件與後門木馬，私自爲用戶安裝很多流氓軟件。

sentences.english: He palmed the door and it opened.
sentences.chinese: 他伸手在門上檢測然後門開了。

sentences.english: Charlie Bairstow vanished through the back door.
sentences.chinese: 貝斯托便從後門溜走了。

sentences.english: He tried opening the back door with the key.
sentences.chinese: 他試着用這把鑰匙開後門。

sentences.english: I avoided meeting her by leaving by the back door.
sentences.chinese: 我從後門離去以免和她相見。

sentences.english: The back door burst open, and he found himself surrounded by policemen.
sentences.chinese: 接着後門被撞開了，他發現他被一羣警察包圍了。

sentences.english: Side door, front and back door can be taken down easily.
sentences.chinese: 可方便拆卸的左右側門和前後門。

sentences.english: He used his influential relatives to help him get in by the back door.
sentences.chinese: 他利用有勢力的親戚以走後門的手段幫他弄到職位。

sentences.english: Beads of water cling to its screen, necklaces unstrung.
sentences.chinese: 水珠粘附在後門的紗屏上，就像鬆開了的項鍊珠子。

definition: (sitting) opposite/across (the street)/directly in front/to be face to face
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
Tianqiao district of Jinan city 濟南市|济南市[Ji3 nan2 shi4], Shandong/Tianqiao district in Beijing, formerly a center of folk culture
car door/door of bus, railway carriage etc
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
